dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Cloudflare CEO on why Apple's Tim Cook, Meta's Mark Zuckerberg, and other tech leaders are bending to Trump
News Content: Big Tech is kissing the ring of President Donald Trump after having a contentious relationship with him in his first term.

That schmoozing was on display at Trump's inauguration as the likes of Meta (META) CEO Mark Zuckerberg, Google (GOOG) CEO Sundar Pichai, and Apple (AAPL) CEO Tim Cook snatched better seats at the event than incoming cabinet members.

"I do think that in a lot of these cases, these are companies that had something that they had to fix. They had problems and potential risk that was out there. And I think they were kind of coming and saying, listen, we're willing to talk to you. We're willing to engage and at some level," Cloudflare co-founder and CEO Matthew Prince told Yahoo Finance at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.

The tech veteran didn't attend the inauguration but added there has been "kind of the war on tech" that hobbled the industry.

"The tech industry is very much like one of the US battleships. It is an incredibly powerful force for the United States, around the rest of the world," he said. "I think if we actually start investing in tech, and not just the big companies, but startups, little tech, all of the different organizations that are out there, that's a huge advantage that the US has."

Cybersecurity stocks have performed relatively well since Donald Trump's election win in early November.

Cloudflare has outperformed its peer group, rising about 28% since Election Day. Fortinet (FTNT) is up 18%. ZScaler (ZS) is up 3%, while Palo Alto Networks (PANW) has shed 3%.

•USD

(NET)

Follow  View Quote Details

The optimism could be traced to several factors.

For one, investment pros say Trump will be friendly to the cybersecurity business model. Recall that in September 2018, Trump signed off on the National Cyber Strategy. The doctrine aimed to encourage government and private investment in cybersecurity infrastructure. It also sought to bolster domestic innovation in the sector.

Second, a mega trend such as AI and potentially looser regulations around dealmaking under Trump may spur profits and valuations on the cybersecurity stocks.

"We believe the cyber security sector will have a robust 2025 and should be one of the strongest sub-sector with our view cyber security could be up 30%+ over the next year led by accelerated cloud and AI growth along with M&A we expect to be very active in this tech area," Wedbush tech analyst Dan Ives said.

And three, a more digital-first world is simply getting riskier by the day, pointed out the World Economic Forum in its 2025 global cybersecurity outlook report. With that comes the need to bolster cybersecurity tools at companies and governments.

Story Continues

"The prevailing turmoil has affected the perception of risks, with one in three CEOs citing cyber espionage and loss of sensitive information/ intellectual property theft as their top concern, while 45% of cyber leaders are concerned about disruption of operations and business processes," the report said.

—

Brian Sozzi is Yahoo Finance's Executive Editor. Follow Sozzi on X @BrianSozzi, Instagram and on LinkedIn. Tips on stories? Email brian.sozzi@yahoofinance.com. Three times each week, Sozzi fields insight-filled conversations with the biggest names in business and markets on Yahoo Finance's Opening Bid podcast. Find more episodes on our video hub. Watch on your preferred streaming service. Or listen and subscribe on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcasts.

Read the latest news and interviews from the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland:

A trade war with China is coming as Trump takes office: Bremmer Bank of America CEO: The Federal Reserve may have to respond to Trump Trump coin and Melania coin are 'gambling tokens': Anthony Scaramucci Federal Reserve could hike rates if Trump tariffs unleash inflation: BNY CEO

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news discusses how tech leaders, including Apple's Tim Cook, are engaging with President Trump after a history of tension, which could lead to more favorable conditions for tech companies including potential regulatory relief and investment incentives. This sentiment is generally positive for the tech sector, and as cybersecurity stocks perform well, it suggests an optimistic outlook for tech investments overall. Given Apple's standing in the market and the potential benefits from a more favorable regulatory environment under Trump, the probability of the stock price rising is relatively high, while the probability of it falling remains lower due to continued market uncertainty.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news headline suggests a potential negative perception of Apple as its CEO is 'bending to Trump,' implying a possible compromise of Apple's values or brand image. However, the broader context of the article focuses on the cybersecurity sector's performance under a potential Trump administration, which is anticipated to be favorable due to looser regulations and increased investment through strategies such as The National Cyber Strategy. This positive outlook primarily benefits cybersecurity firms directly (Cloudflare, Fortinet, ZScaler, Palo Alto Networks) making the effect on Apple negligible because they exist in different industries. Furthermore, the article includes multiple events besides Apple's actions, e.g. Zuckerberg and Pichai 'schmoozing,' and broader benefits to cybersecurity firms unrelated to Apple. Considering these conflicting views the effect of this news is neutral. There may be a slight negative impact due to the implied perception of bending to Trump, but Apple's overall financial performance is unlikely to be dramatically affected.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article focuses on the relationship between Big Tech CEOs, including Apple's Tim Cook, and President Trump.  While it mentions that Cook attended Trump's inauguration, implying some level of appeasement, the article's primary focus is on the cybersecurity sector's positive outlook under Trump's administration.  This positive outlook stems from anticipated government support for cybersecurity infrastructure, potential deregulation boosting M&A activity, and a generally riskier digital landscape driving demand for cybersecurity solutions. Apple, while a major tech company, is not directly involved in the cybersecurity sector discussed in detail.  Therefore, the impact of this news on Apple's stock price is likely indirect and minimal.  Any stock price movement would be more influenced by broader market trends and Apple's own performance rather than this specific political interaction.  The probability of a price rise or fall is thus closer to a neutral position, slightly weighted toward no change given the lack of direct relevance.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.2, Reasoning: The news discusses the relationship between Big Tech leaders, including Apple's Tim Cook, and President Donald Trump, suggesting a potential easing of tensions and possible regulatory benefits. However, the primary focus of the article is on cybersecurity stocks and their performance under Trump's policies, with only a tangential mention of Apple. Given the lack of direct impact on Apple's business model or financials from this news, the effect on Apple's stock price is likely neutral. The article does not provide any specific positive or negative catalysts for Apple, and the broader market sentiment around tech remains mixed.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news article discusses the potential benefits of a Trump presidency for the tech industry, particularly cybersecurity stocks. Cloudflare's CEO mentions that tech companies are willing to engage with Trump, and the article highlights the potential for increased investment in cybersecurity infrastructure and looser regulations. Additionally, the article cites an analyst's prediction that the cybersecurity sector will have a robust 2025, with potential growth of 30% or more. However, the article also mentions that the tech industry had a contentious relationship with Trump in his first term, which could lead to uncertainty and potential negative impacts on the stock price. Considering these factors, I estimate that the probability of the stock price rising is higher than the probability of it falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The financial news discusses a shift in engagement from major tech leaders to the Trump administration, suggesting a willingness to cooperate despite previous conflicts. While the focus is not directly on Apple, the article draws attention to other tech companies' relationships with Trump. There are positive signals from the perspective of cybersecurity advancements and government support, which could indirectly benefit Apple. However, the overall tone does not suggest direct positive news for Apple.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news indicates a shift in engagement between major tech leaders and President Trump, suggesting a potential easing of tensions and the possibility of favorable conditions for tech companies, including regulatory relief and investment incentives. While Apple's association with Trump may raise concerns about brand perception, the broader implications point towards a positive outlook for the tech sector and cybersecurity market. Given that Apple is well-positioned in the market and may indirectly benefit from increased investment in technology and cybersecurity, the prediction leans towards a higher likelihood of a stock price rise while accounting for some level of uncertainty. The mixed previous predictions indicate that while there are some concerns, the overall sentiment remains cautiously optimistic regarding Apple's future growth.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news focuses on the tech industry's engagement with a potentially incoming Trump administration. While the article highlights the positive outlook for the cybersecurity sector and potential benefits from looser regulations and increased investments, it also suggests a shift in stance by tech leaders, including Apple's Tim Cook. This shift, though potentially beneficial, can be perceived negatively as 'bending to Trump,' impacting Apple's brand image. However, The overall market and company-specific factors play a more significant role in Apple's stock performance. Considering The previous round's prediction trend, with some models predicting increase and others decrease in stock prices, I believe the impact on Apple's stock is likely to be minimal in this moment, potentially leaning slightly negative due to the possible perception of compromising brand values.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news focuses on the improved relationship between Big Tech and the Trump administration, particularly its positive impact on the cybersecurity sector.  While Apple's CEO's attendance at Trump's inauguration is mentioned, the article lacks direct, impactful news regarding Apple's financials or operations. The overwhelmingly positive outlook is for cybersecurity companies, not Apple, which operates in a different sector.  Therefore, the impact of this news on Apple's stock price is likely to be minimal.  Any stock price movement will probably be driven by broader market trends and Apple's own performance, not this specific political interaction. The previous predictions show a wide range of opinions, highlighting the ambiguity of the news concerning AAPL.  Considering the indirect and potentially neutral nature of the news regarding Apple and the varied opinions, I'm assigning a slightly higher probability to no significant change than to either a rise or fall.
